security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only instructions for AI-assisted code review. No executable code, scripts, or network calls. Operates through AI model following platform-controlled tool access policies.

content.user_title: Verify code quality with web research
content.value_statement: Code reviews often miss outdated dependencies and deprecated patterns. This skill performs deep quality analysis with real-time web research to verify versions, check security vulnerabilities, and validate against current documentation.
actual_capabilities: Reviews code for correctness, edge cases, and error handling
Verifies dependencies against latest stable versions using WebSearch
Checks current documentation patterns using WebFetch
Provides structured quality scores with actionable feedback
limitations: Does not execute code or run tests
Cannot modify files or make changes directly
Limited to web research when explicit triggers are used
Relies on AI model to follow review protocol correctly

use_cases.title: Pre-merge code review
use_cases.description: Verify code quality and dependencies before merging pull requests with real-time version checks.

use_cases.title: Security vulnerability audit
use_cases.description: Check for outdated dependencies with known security issues against current vulnerability databases.

use_cases.title: Architecture review
use_cases.description: Analyze implementation patterns against latest library recommendations and best practices.

prompt_templates.title: Quick correctness check
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this code for correctness. Check edge cases, error handling, and potential bugs. [paste code]

prompt_templates.title: Full dependency audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Double check our dependencies against latest versions. Flag anything behind and check for security issues.

prompt_templates.title: Documentation verification
prompt_templates.prompt: Verify we are using the current React/Vite patterns. Check the official docs for any changes.

prompt_templates.title: Complete quality review
prompt_templates.prompt: Do a full quality review. Check correctness, anti-bloat, elegance, standards, versions, and documentation compliance. [paste code or specify files]

output_examples.input: Review our React component for quality and verify we are using latest patterns.

best_practices: Use explicit triggers like 'double check against latest docs' to invoke web research
Request version checks even when dependencies have not changed
Distinguish between critical issues and nice-to-have suggestions
Always provide specific line numbers and concrete improvement suggestions
anti_patterns: Using this skill for simple syntax checks (automatic hook handles these)
Skipping web research when verifying outdated patterns
Failing to acknowledge when automatic hook already ran
Not checking security vulnerabilities when reviewing dependencies

faq.question: What is the difference between this skill and the automatic quality hook?
faq.answer: The automatic hook runs fast checks on every change using existing knowledge. This skill performs deep review with web research to verify latest versions and documentation.

faq.question: What tools does this skill use?
faq.answer: This skill uses WebSearch for version checks and WebFetch for documentation verification. Tool access is controlled by the platform.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-based skill with no executable code. Code review happens through AI model processing with platform-controlled tool access.

faq.question: Can this skill modify my files?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides review instructions only. It does not execute code or make any file changes.

faq.question: When should I invoke this skill?
faq.answer: Use it when you need verification against latest docs, version checks, security analysis, or deep review beyond the automatic hook.

faq.question: Does this skill work with all programming languages?
faq.answer: Yes. The review framework is language-agnostic. Version and documentation checks apply to libraries and frameworks used in your project.
